cmCourseInfo.description: Forest conservation issues in Canada; development of forest management philosophy in Canadian and temperate forest regions; and concepts of sustainability. Techniques for more sustainable forest management: structural retention; forest certification; old growth; value-added and non-traditional forest products.
cmCourseInfo.title: Conservation of Canada's Forests

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

cmCourseInfo.description: A ten day field course examining urban forestry issues in the GTA, southern and eastern Ontario and Quebec. Topics include: urban forest inventories, nursery production, arboricultural techniques, urban woodland management, urban forest health, urban forest administration, urban dendrology, and urban forestry research. Additional fees for field course (e.g. accommmodation, food, other within course travel expenses) will apply. See Faculty website for details. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Urban Forest Conservation Field Camp
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: FOR200H1, FOR201H1, or permission of the instructor.

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Please fill out and hand in an “E” Enrolment form by Wednesday, April 12, 2017 to Laura Lapchinski, Forestry Undergraduate Administrator, Room 1017A, Earth Sciences Building, or email to her at laura.lapchinski@utoronto.ca. You may also email her to request a copy of the form. Once accepted into the course, ancillary fees of $740.00 (hotel, travel) will need to be paid (cash or cheque) by Thursday, April 20, 2017. Students will also be required to pay for their own meals on the trip. The FOR418H1 Urban Forest Conservation Field Camp will run from May 7 to May 19, 2017.
